      • initializeListenerForStackPane

        private void initializeListenerForStackPane()
        Iterates through each of the gamePane's child nodes and if it is a stackpane, a listener is added to it. This listener is then used to select the stackpane that is clicked on in click-to-draw

      • clickToDraw

        private void clickToDraw​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        This method handles the game where the user clicks nodes in order to draw edges between them. By clicking a node the user primes that node for drawing and when clicking another node a edge is drawn between the nodes (if the edge is legal).
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The mouse click the user performs.

      • onMouseClicked

        public void onMouseClicked​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseClick)
        If the user has selected a node and clicks on something else than a node the selected node is deselected and the user is free to select a new node.
        Parameters:
        mouseClick - The mouse click the user performs.

      • updateCanvasClick

        private void updateCanvasClick()
        This method is called when the user finishes his/her move in click to draw. If the user had no collisions and drew a valid line this method will call upon the view to display the newly generated node and a listener on it.

      • updateCanvasDrag

        private void updateCanvasDrag()
        This method is called when the user finishes his/her move in drag to draw. If the user had no collisions and drew a valid line this method will call upon the view to display the newly generated node.

      • attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes

        public void attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle startNode,
                                        javafx.scene.shape.Circle endNode)
                                 throws IllegalNodesChosenException,
                                        GameEndedException,
                                        CollisionException,
                                        NoValidEdgeException,
                                        InvalidPath
        Description copied from class: SproutController
        Initializes the drawing of a new edge if the nodes chosen are eligible Used in strict mode.
        Overrides:
        attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes in class SproutController
        Parameters:
        startNode - : Start node shape
        endNode - : End node shape
        Throws:
        IllegalNodesChosenException - if the nodes chosen are not in the game
        GameEndedException - if the edge is drawn, and there are no valid moves left on the gameboard
        CollisionException - if the new edge collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        NoValidEdgeException - if the is no valid edge between the chosen nodes
        InvalidPath

      • primeNodeToDrawEdgeFrom

        private void primeNodeToDrawEdgeFrom​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle selectedNode)
        Parameters:
        selectedNode - the node the user has selected

      • mousePressedHandler

        public void mousePressedHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mousePressed)
        This method is called when the user presses on a node in the game mode: drag to draw. It takes a mouseEvent and sets up the model and the view A path is initialized only if it starts from a node
        Parameters:
        mousePressed - The mouse press the user performs.

      • mouseDraggedHandler

        public void mouseDraggedHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseDragged)
        Repeatedly called when the user is dragging his mouse in order to draw. Calls the model's method that draws path to mousevent's coordinates and the method that checks for intersections/collisions
        Parameters:
        mouseDragged - the mouse drag the user performs. This MouseEvent contains coordinates.

      • mouseReleasedHandler

        public void mouseReleasedHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseReleased)
        This method is called when the user finishes a drawing in drag to draw. A path is finished, only if it ends in a node. If the user had no collisions the path can be added to list of valid lines and a new node can be generated on the path.
        Parameters:
        mouseReleased - The mouse release the user performs.

      • finishPathHelper

        private void finishPathHelper​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Helper method that calls other methods that try to finish the drawing if it is valid and changes the cursor from a crosshair to a normal one.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The mouse release the user performs.

      • setNumberOfInitialNodes

        void setNumberOfInitialNodes​(int numberOfInitialNodes)

      • setSmartGame

        public void setSmartGame​(boolean smartGame)
